activities.loc: Br 9 - Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leroy John Payne Jr

Defense states that defendant is saving money to retain counsel, requests 60 days.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary hearing waived, probable cause found, bound over.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Patricia J Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leroy John Payne Jr in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Leroy John Payne Jr. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant is still working on retaining private counsel, requests a PH be set.
BTC: Matter can have one final adjournment, PH to take place regardless of status of attorney.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leroy John Payne Jr in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Leroy John Payne Jr. Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Defendant requests more time to retain private counsel.
state does not object to postponing preliminaryhearing. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits.
Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim V.C (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with witnesses in complaint. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

2:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leroy John Payne Jr in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Leroy John Payne Jr. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant, Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
